meanings.definition: The action of catching or trapping someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The entrapment of the mouse in the trap was successful.
meanings.sent2: The police set up a sting operation to catch the criminals in entrapment.
meanings.sent3: The entrapment of the butterfly in the net was accidental.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an entrapment that lured him in.
meanings.sent5: The entrapment of the spider's prey was swift and efficient.

meanings.definition: The state of being caught or trapped in a situation.
meanings.sent1: She felt a sense of entrapment in her boring job.
meanings.sent2: The entrapment of the hikers in the cave was a scary experience.
meanings.sent3: His entrapment in the traffic jam made him late for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The entrapment of the bird in the cage symbolized freedom lost.
meanings.sent5: The entrapment of the character in the maze added suspense to the story.
